description: Lymphocytic Infiltrate of Jessner is a benign skin condition characterized by small, red to brownish papules or plaques that typically appear on the face, neck, or upper back. It is considered a chronic inflammatory disorder of unknown cause.
possible causes: Exact cause is unknown, but it is believed to be an immune-mediated response.
symptoms: Small, red to brownish papules or plaques on the skin
Lesions may be flat or slightly raised
